src: “Ní báyìí a ní àwọn ẹku olóṣù mẹ́rin tí kò ní dayabẹ́tìsì tẹ́lẹ̀tẹ́lẹ̀ tó ti ní ayabẹ́tìsì̀,” o ṣe àfikún.
mt: “We have four new cases of COVID-19, none of whom had a travel history,” he said.
ref: "We now have 4-month-old mice that are non-diabetic that used to be diabetic," he added.

src: Dókítà Ehud, akọ́ṣẹmọṣẹ́ ìmọ̀ ogun ní ilé ẹ̀kọ́ gíga Dalhousie ní Halifax, Nova Scotia àti alága ìpín ti ìṣègùn àti ìmọ̀ síẹ̀nsì ti Ẹgbé Ìtọ ṣúggà ti Ará Ìlú Canada sọ pé ìwádìí náà ṣì jẹ́ tuntun.
mt: Dr. Ehud, a professor of military medicine at Dalhousie University in Halifax, Nova Scotia and the head of the Canadian Forces' medical research unit, said the device would be a breakthrough.
ref: Dr. Ehud Ur, professor of medicine at Dalhousie University in Halifax, Nova Scotia and chair of the clinical and scientific division of the Canadian Diabetes Association cautioned that the research is still in its early days.

src: Bí àwọn àkọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́, ó ṣiyèméjì bóyá àrùn ìtọ ṣúgá lè ní ìwòsàn, tí ó sì mọ̀ pé kò wúlò fún àwọn tó bá ní àrùn ìtọ ṣúgá Type 1.
mt: As the researchers note, the vaccine is not a cure for Type 1 diabetes, but it may prevent it.
ref: Like some other experts, he is skeptical about whether diabetes can be cured, noting that these findings have no relevance to people who already have Type 1 diabetes.

src: Ní ọjọ́ Ajé, Sara Danius, akọ̀wé àgbà ti ẹgbẹ́ Nobel fún ìtàn àròsọ ní ilé ẹ̀ka Swedin, tí wọ́n kéde ní ètò kan lóri rẹ́díò lóri rẹ́díò Svergies ní Sweden, àwọn ẹgbk kò lè dé ọ̀dọ̀ BobDylan nípa bíborí ní 2016 Nobel Prize Literature, ó ti rẹ̀ wọ́n láti kàn si.
mt: On Monday, Sara Danius, the head of the Swedish Academy for Literature, announced that BobDylan will not be able to attend the 2016 Nobel Prize Literature ceremony, as he is currently on tour.
ref: On Monday, Sara Danius, permanent secretary of the Nobel Committee for Literature at the Swedish Academy, publicly announced during a radio program on Sveriges Radio in Sweden the committee, unable to reach Bob Dylan directly about winning the 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature, had abandoned its efforts to reach him.

src: Daniusi wipe, “Nisin a o se nkankan. Mo ti meeli ranse mo de ti pe si awon ajo sise timo timo re won de fun mi lesi to loyaya. Fun igba yi, o daniloju pe iyen ti to.”
mt: "I'm not sure what happened. I was flying at a low altitude. I was about to land when the engine stopped."
ref: Danius said, "Right now we are doing nothing. I have called and sent emails to his closest collaborator and received very friendly replies. For now, that is certainly enough."

src: Tẹ́lẹ̀rí, olùdarí àgbà iléeṣẹ́ Ring, Jamie Siminoff ní iléeṣẹ́ náà bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ nígbà tí aago ẹnu ọ̀nà òhun kò dún sókè látinú ṣọ́ọ̀bù dé inú gáràjì.
mt: Previously, Ring CEO Jamie Siminoff started the company when he was 29 years old and had no college degree.
ref: Previously, Ring's CEO, Jamie Siminoff, remarked the company started when his doorbell wasn't audible from his shop in his garage.

src: O ko ago ilekun WiFi, O wi.
mt: 1. He has a WiFi connection, he is connected.
ref: He built a WiFi door bell, he said.

src: Siminoff sọ pé ọjà lọ sókè lẹ́yìn tí òun hàn nínú eré Shark Tank lọ́dún 2013, ní ibi tí àwọn aláṣẹ eré ti ṣẹ́ pẹ̀ẹ́ lórí ìkówó lé eré ìbẹ̀rẹ̀.
mt: Siminoff appeared on Shark Tank in 2013, where the show's investors passed on the company's initial pitch.
ref: Siminoff said sales boosted after his 2013 appearance in a Shark Tank episode where the show panel declined funding the startup.

src: Ni eba ipari odun 2017, Siminoff fi ara han lori itakun mohun maworan ti awon ontaja QVC.
mt: 2017, Siminoff founded the company Mohu, which makes antennas for over-the-air television.
ref: In late 2017, Siminoff appeared on shopping television channel QVC.

src: Òrùká sì parí ęjọ́ pẹ̀lú ìlé Iṣẹ́ aláàbò tí wọ́n jọ ń figagbága- Ile Iṣẹ́ Nlá ADT.
mt: 2 people were killed in a fire at a factory in the city of ADT.
ref: Ring also settled a lawsuit with competing security company, the ADT Corporation.

src: Nígbàtí àwárí òògùn kan fojú hàn láti dín ikú èbólà kù, títí di àsìkò yìí, kò tí i sí òògùn kan pàtó tí a sàfihàn pé ó lágbára láti tọ́jú ààrùn tó wà nílẹ̀.
mt: As the first case of Ebola was announced, no one knew that a vaccine would be ready in this short time.
ref: While one experimental vaccine appears able to reduce Ebola mortality, up until now, no drugs have been clearly demonstrated suitable for treating existing infection.

src: Àmúlùmálà apakòkòrò kan, ZMapp, ṣàfihàn ìlérí ní pápá, ṣùgbọ́n àwọn ẹ̀kọ́ ti tẹ́lẹ́ tóka pé o ní àǹfàní tó kéré láti dènà ikú.
mt: 1 of 2 experimental Ebola drugs, ZMapp, has shown promise in primates, but previous studies showed it was not effective against death.
ref: One antibody cocktail, ZMapp, initially showed promise in the field, but formal studies indicated it had less benefit than sought in preventing death.

src: Ní ìtọ́wò PALM ZMapp jẹ́ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìṣàkóso o túmọ̀ si wípé àwọn onímọ̀ sayensi fi ṣe gbendeke wọ́n dẹ̀ fi wé àwọn ogun mẹ́ta ìyóku.
mt: The PALM ZMapp was developed as a treatment for Ebola virus disease, which has a fatality rate of up to 90%.
ref: In the PALM trial, ZMapp served as a control, meaning scientists used it as a baseline and compared the three other treatments to it.

src: Ẹgbẹ́ Ajìjàkadi ilẹ̀ Àmẹ́ríkà fọwọ́ sí lẹtà ìgbìmọ̀ Olympics, wọ́n sì gbà á wọlé pé Àpapọ̀-Ebi-Olympics nilò láti rí dájú pé wọ́n pèsè àyíká tí ó dára fún àwọn oníjàkadì/asáré-ìje wa gbogbo.
mt: The American Anti-Doping Agency has announced that the 2016 Olympics will be the first to use a new drug testing system that will allow for more rapid detection of banned substances in all athletes.
ref: USA Gymnastics supports the United States Olympic Committee's letter and accepts the absolute need of the Olympic family to promote a safe environment for all of our athletes.

src: A gba ọ̀rọ̀ USOC pé a lẹ̀ sin ànfàní àwọn eléré ìdárayá wa àti àwọn ẹgbe ìdárayá, àti eré ìdárayá wọn tí a bá tẹ̀síwájú pẹ̀lú ayipada tó ní túmọ̀ ní ilé ìṣe wa, ju yiyo ìwé aṣe kuro.
mt: The USOC said it will continue to support the athletes and their families, as well as the coaches, with counseling, if needed.
ref: We agree with the USOC's statement that the interests of our athletes and clubs, and their sport, may be better served by moving forward with meaningful change within our organization, rather than decertification.

src: Eréje Gymnastics ti ilẹ̀ USA sàtìlẹyìn fún ìwádìí olómìnira tí ó lè tan ìmọ́lẹ̀ lórí àsìlò ìpín ní àwọn tó móríye ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ Larry Nassar sàpéjúwe pẹ̀lú akitiyan. ní kò bá ti lọ láì rí fún ọjọ́ pípẹ́ àti gbígba àwọn àyípadà tó yẹ.
mt: 2018 Winter Olympics gymnastics team captain Aly Raisman testified in court about the abuse she suffered at the hands of Larry Nassar, who was sentenced to 175 years in prison for sexually abusing young female athletes.
ref: USA Gymnastics supports an independent investigation that may shine light on how abuse of the proportion described so courageously by the survivors of Larry Nassar could have gone undetected for so long and embraces any necessary and appropriate changes.

src: Àwọn Asángun ilẹ̀ USA ati USOC ní àfojúsùn kanáà — èyí tó mún kí ààbò eré ìdárayá ìsangun àtawọn míran wà fáwọn eléréje láti le ma siṣẹ́ tọ àlá wọn ní àyíká tó láàbò, tó dára tó sì seégbé.
mt: The USOC and USA Gymnastics announced a joint investigation — this after the sexual abuse of athletes by a team doctor was revealed, and the organization failed to act.
ref: USA Gymnastics and the USOC have the same goal — making the sport of gymnastics, and others, as safe as possible for athletes to follow their dreams in a safe, positive and empowered environment.

src: Ni gbogbo 1960S Bresinski sise fun Johannu F Kenedi gege bi onimoran re, o tun sise fun isakoso Lindoni B Jonsin.
mt: 1960s Bresinski wrote to John F Kennedy, and also to Lyndon B Johnson.
ref: Throughout 1960s, Brzezinski worked for John F. Kennedy as his advisor and then the Lyndon B. Johnson administration.

src: Lákòókò ìsàlẹ́ṣà ọdún 1976, ó gba Carter nímọ̀ràn lórí ilẹ̀ òkèrè, lẹ́yìn èyí ó jẹ́ olùdámọ̀ràn ààbò àpapọ̀ (NSA) láti ọdún 1977 sí 1981, ẹni tó gbapò Henry Kissinger.
mt: 1976, he was appointed National Security Advisor from 1977 to 1981, succeeding Henry Kissinger.
ref: During the 1976 selections he advised Carter on foreign policy, then served as National Security Advisor (NSA) from 1977 to 1981, succeeding Henry Kissinger.

src: Bi i NSA, ó ran Carter lọ́wọ́ ní yíyanjú Ètò Àgbáyé, bí i Camp David Accords ti ọdún 1978; mímú áyípadà bá àjọsepọ̀ ilẹ̀ US–China ní ọwọ ìparí 1970s; Ìjagbara àwọn ilẹ̀ Iran tí ó yorí sí rògbòdìyàn ìdógo àwọn Iran ní ọdún, 1979; àti yíyalu àwọn Soviet ní Afghanistan ní ọdún 1979.
mt: 1979 was the year of the Camp David Accords, the normalization of US-China relations, the Iranian Revolution, and the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan.
ref: As NSA, he assisted Carter in diplomatically handling world affairs, such as the Camp David Accords, 1978; normalizing US–China relations thought the late 1970s; the Iranian Revolution, which led to the Iran hostage crisis, 1979; and the Soviet invasion in Afghanistan, 1979.

src: Fíìmú tó sàfihàn Ryan Gosling àti Emma Stone gba yíyàn nì gbogbo éka pàtàkì.
mt: 2016 film La La Land won all major awards.
ref: The movie, featuring Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone, received nominations in all major categories.

src: Goslini àti Okuta yege fún ìbò Eléré Ọkùnrin àti Eléré Obinrin ní kọ̀kan wọn.
mt: Goslini and Okuta are the first female and male champions respectively.
ref: Gosling and Stone received nominations for Best Actor and Actress respectively.

src: Awọn ìsọ̀rí mìíràn ni, Àwòrán tó dára jù, Olùdarí, Àyàwòrán, Aṣaralóge, Asàtúntò-Fíìmù, Aṣàtúntò ohùn, Apohùnpọ̀, àti Akọ̀tà.
mt: 1. The first letter of the alphabet is A. 2. The second letter of the alphabet is B. 3. The third letter of the alphabet is C. 4. The fourth letter of the alphabet is D. 5. The fifth letter of the alphabet is E. 6. The sixth letter of the alphabet is F. 7. The seventh letter of the alphabet is G. 8. The eighth letter of the alphabet is H. 9. The ninth letter of the alphabet is I. 10. The tenth letter of the alphabet is J.
ref: The other nominations include Best Picture, Director, Cinematography, Costume Design, Film-editing, Original Score, Production Design, Sound Editing, Sound Mixing and Original Screenplay.

src: Orin méjì látinú àgbéléwò, ìdánwò (Àwọn òmùgọ̀ tó ń lá àlá) àti ìlú àwọn ìràwọ̀ ni wọ́n mún fún orin ojúlówó tó dára jù. ilé ìsiṣẹ́ Lionsgate ló gba ìyànsípò mẹ́rìndínlọ́gbọ̀n — jú àwọn ilé ìsiṣẹ̀ mìíràn lọ.
mt: 2.5 hours of footage, including behind-the-scenes (B-roll) and b-roll of the city of Los Angeles, were provided to Lionsgate for $35,000 — more than other production companies.
ref: Two songs from the movie, Audition (The Fools Who Dream) and City of Stars, received nominations for best original song. Lionsgate studio received 26 nominations — more than any other studio.

src: Ní alẹ́ ọjọ́ àìkú, àrẹ oríll èdè Amẹ́ríkà Donald Trump, ní ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ tí ó sọ nípasẹ̀ ọ̀gá oníròyìn, kéde pé àwọn ọmọ ogun US ma fi ìlú Syria sílẹ̀.
mt: On Sunday, US President Donald Trump, in a statement through his press secretary, announced that US troops would be withdrawn from Syria.
ref: Late on Sunday, the United States President Donald Trump, in a statement delivered via the press secretary, announced US troops would be leaving Syria.

src: Won se ikede naa leyin ti Trumpi ba Aare Toki Resep Tayipi Edogani lori ago.
mt: We report that Trump has invited President Tayyip Erdogan to the White House.
ref: The announcement was made after Trump had a phone conversation with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan.

src: Turkey yíò pẹ̀lú àmójútó ìdábòbò àwọn ọlótè ISIS tí wọ́n mú, èyí tí àlàyé fi síta , àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè Yúróòpù tí kọ̀ jálè láti fi ipá gbé padà sí ìlú wọn.
mt: Turkey will take back the ISIS fighters it captured, according to reports, European countries that have taken them in will have to take them back.
ref: Turkey would also take over guarding captured ISIS fighters which, the statement said, European nations have refused to repatriate.

src: Èyì kò ṣàrídájú pé ó kéré jù àwọn dinosaurs ní ìyẹ́,ọ̀rọ̀ tó dájú tí ó ti tànká, ṣùgbọ́n ó pèsè ẹ̀kúnrẹ́rẹ́ àlàyé egungun ẹranko dinosaurs bíi àwọ́ àti títò lanà mẹt.
mt: It is not clear whether the new findings will change the long-held belief that dinosaurs were cold-blooded, but they do provide new evidence that some dinosaurs were warm-blooded, like birds and mammals.
ref: This not only confirms that at least some dinosaurs had feathers, a theory already widespread, but provides details fossils generally cannot, such as color and three-dimensional arrangement.

src: Awon onimo sayensi wipe iye eranko naa je awo sesnut- burawuni lori pelu awo sisi tabi awo-karotenoidi labe.
mt: Scientists say the amount of vitamin A in the diet is important for eye health, with the best sources being animal products such as liver and fish, or plant carotenoids such as beta-carotene.
ref: . Scientists say this animal's plumage was chestnut-brown on top with a pale or carotenoid-colored underside.

src: Wíwá náà tún fúni lóyẹ sí ìtànkálè ti àwọn ìyé nínú ẹyẹ.
mt: The statement also noted that the crash occurred during a training flight.
ref: The find also grants insight into the evolution of feathers in birds.

src: Nítorí ìyẹ́ dánísọ̀̀ kò ní ọpá tó gbó káká, tí wọ́n ń pè ní rachis, ṣùgbọ́n ó ní àwọn àbùdá ìyé mìíràn – barbs àti barbules – àwọn aṣèwádìí sọ ohun tó jọ́ wípé rachis ṣeéṣe kí o jẹ́ àbùdá ìyẹ́ tí ó ti wà tipẹ́ síwájú àwọn ìyók.
mt: Because the rachis lacks a terminal spike, it is called a spikelet, but it has other appendages – barbs and barbules – that the appendages of the spikelet, called glumes, lack.
ref: Because the dinosaur feathers do not have a well-developed shaft, called a rachis, but do have other features of feathers — barbs and barbules — the researchers inferred the rachis was likely a later evolutionary development that these other features.

src: Ohun tó dàbí ìyẹ dábàá pé kí wọ́n má lò nínu ọkọ̀ òfurufú ṣùgbọ́n fún títọ́ ara gbígbónà sọ́nà tàbí láti ṣàfihàn. Àwọn aṣèwádìí da lábàá pé, kódà èyí jẹ́ ìrù ọmọ dinosaur, àpẹrẹ rẹ ṣàfihàn ti àgbàlagbà.
mt: It is possible that the dinosaur-like creature was a fossil, but the researchers say it is too early to tell.
ref: The feathers' structure suggests that they were not used in flight but rather for temperature regulation or display. The researchers suggested that, even though this is the tail of a young dinosaur, the sample shows adult plumage and not a chick's down.

src: Àwọn aṣàwárí dalábàá pé, bí ètí bá jẹ́ ìrù ọmọ dinosaur, àpẹrẹ rẹ̀ ṣàfihàn ti àgbàlagbà kìn ṣe ti ọmọdé.
mt: Some scientists believe that if dinosaurs had survived, they would have evolved into birds.
ref: The researchers suggested that, even though this is the tail of a young dinosaur, the sample shows adult plumage and not a chick's down.

src: Àdó olóró tí wọ́n so mọ ọkọ̀ tí wọ́n wa lọ sí àgọ́ àwọn ọlọ́pàá ní Gaziantep, lórílẹ̀èdèTurkey, láàárọ̀ àná pa ọlọ́pàá méjì, tí ó sì ṣe àwọn tó tó ogún léṣe.
mt: A Turkish military plane crashed into a residential area in Gaziantep, killing two civilians and injuring three others.
ref: A car bomb detonated at police headquarters in Gaziantep, Turkey yesterday morning killed two police officers and injured more than twenty other people.

src: Ọfíìsì Gómínà sọ pé mọ́kàndínlógún nínú àwọn tí ó fi ara pa jẹ́ ọlọ́pàá.
mt: 3 people were killed in the crash.
ref: The governor's office said nineteen of the injured were police officers.

src: Ọlọ́pa sọ pé àwọn funra sí ọmọ ogun Daesh (ISIL) fún ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ná.
mt: 2 people were killed by Daesh (ISIL) militants in the attack.
ref: Police said they suspect an alleged Daesh (ISIL) militant of responsibility for the attack.

src: Wọn rí ìsàmúlò ìlànà kan náà lórí oòrùn bí i ti ìràwọ̀: Ìṣe gbogbo àwọn ìràwọ̀ ni a kíyèsí pé yíyí wọn àti ìse wọn nìkan ni ó ń darí wọn, kò sí nǹkan mìíràn.
mt: 1. All the cells are the same, and they all divide in the same way: they divide into two cells.
ref: They found the Sun operated on the same basic principles as other stars: The activity of all stars in the system was found to be driven by their luminosity, their rotation, and nothing else.

src: A máà n lo luminositi ati iyipo papọ̀ láti fi mọ onka rosbi irawo, ti o ní Ṣe pẹ̀lú bí olasma Ṣe wàn s.
mt: The researchers used a combination of luminescence and mass spectrometry to identify the rosin, which is produced by the pine tree.
ref: The luminosity and rotation are used together to determine a star's Rossby number, which is related to plasma flow.

src: Bí nọ́ḿbà Rossby bá se kéré tó, bẹ́ẹ̀ náà ni iye ìràwọ̀ kò se ní lágbára sí ní ìtọ́ka sí ìdápadà sẹ́yìn agbérin.
mt: As the Rossby number increases, the flow becomes more stable and the eddies are less likely to interact with the boundary.
ref: The smaller the Rossby number, the less active the star with respect to magnetic reversals.

src: Nínú ìrìnàjò rẹ´, Iwasaki bọ sínú wàhálà ní ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ ìgbà.
mt: In his statement, Iwasaki said he had been in the cockpit for a long time.
ref: During his trip, Iwasaki ran into trouble on many occasions.

src: Àwọn ajalèlókun ló jàálólè, wọ́n jalè ní Tibet nípa lílo ajá elégbọn, ó sá kúrò nínu ìgbáyàwó rẹ wọ́n sì mu ní India.
mt: 2 terrorists were killed, they were killed in Tibet using a bomb, they also crossed into India.
ref: He was robbed by pirates, attacked in Tibet by a rabid dog, escaped marriage in Nepal and was arrested in India.

src: Eto 802.11n sise pelu eto igbohun si afefe 2.4Ghz ati 5.0Ghz.
mt: 802.11n uses both 2.4GHz and 5.0GHz bands.
ref: The 802.11n standard operates on both the 2.4Ghz and 5.0Ghz frequencies.

src: Èyí yíò fún ní àǹfànni láti padà sẹ́yìn pẹ̀lú 802.11a, 802.11b àti 802.11g, èyí tó pèsè ibùdó o ní rádíò méjì.
mt: 802.11a, 802.11b and 802.11g are all supported, allowing for dual-band operation.
ref: This will allow it to be backwards compatible with 802.11a, 802.11b and 802.11g, provided that the base station has dual radios.

src: Ìyára méjìlélẹ̀gbẹrin ó lé mọ́kànlá ni wọ́n má ń yára jùlọ pẹ̀lú àkọsílẹ̀ tíọ́rì tó gajù jẹ́ ẹgbẹ̀taMbit/s.
mt: 2.5Gbit/s is the fastest speed achieved so far with a single laser.
ref: The speeds of 802.11n are substantially faster than that of its predecessors with a maximum theoretical throughput of 600Mbit/s.

src: Dufaali to ti Ṣe ìgbéyàwó pẹ̀lú Ọmọ méjì o fí bẹ́ẹ̀ dá Mila, ti ìtàn náà tan mó, lọ́rùn.
mt: 2 years ago, Mila married a man, but that story ended in divorce.
ref: Duvall, who is married with two adult children, did not leave a big impression on Miller, to whom the story was related.

src: Nígbà tí a bèrè fún ìdásí, Miller sọ pé, “Mike ma ń sọ̀rọ̀ jù nípa kíkà... Mò ń gbáradìnítorínà mi kò gba ǹkan tí ó sọ.”
mt: When asked about the incident, Miller said, "Mike was talking about how... I didn't hear anything he said."
ref: When asked for comment, Miller said, "Mike talks a lot during the hearing...I was getting ready so I wasn't really hearing what he was saying."

src: “A ó tiraka láti gé ohun tí ó ń jáde carbon dioxide lóní ìwọ̀n GDP pẹ̀lú àmì tó farahàn bí yíò bá fi di 2020 láti ìpele 2005 gẹ́gẹ́ bí” Hu se sọ.
mt: “It is estimated that the carbon dioxide emissions will increase by 2020 from 2005 levels as” Hu said.
ref: "We will endeavour to cut carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP by a notable margin by 2020 from the 2005 level," Hu said.

src: Kò sàgbékalẹ̀ iye kankan fún ègé náà, sọ pé wọ́n yíò se é ní ìbámu àbájáde ọrọ̀ ajé ilẹ̀ China.
mt: No official figures have been released, but the incident is expected to have a major impact on China's economy.
ref: He did not set a figure for the cuts, saying they will be made based on China's economic output.

src: Hu gba àwọn orílẹ̀èdè tó sẹ̀sẹ̀ ń dàgbà níyànjú láti “kọ ọ̀nà àtijọ́ tí wọ́n má ń ba àyíká jẹ́ saájú kí wọ́n tó tún un se bóbá yá.”
mt: The countries agreed to “develop a roadmap to ensure that they can continue to work together to tackle the threat of climate change.”
ref: Hu encouraged developing countries "to avoid the old path of polluting first and cleaning up later."

src: O fikun pé “kí wọ́n máṣe, síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, wọ́n ma sọ fún láti pọndandan rẹ kọjá ìpele ìdàgbàsóké, ojúṣe àti agbár.”
mt: “They were told to ‘get out, get out, get out’ before the plane was engulfed in flames, smoke and fire.”
ref: He added that "they should not, however, be asked to take on obligations that go beyond their development stage, responsibility and capabilities."

src: Ẹgbẹ́ aṣèwádìí ilẹ̀ Iraq se àgbékalẹ̀ àbábọ̀ rẹ̀ ní nǹkan bí i aago méjìlá ọ̀sán òní.
mt: 2nd Brigade of the Iraqi Army Corps of Engineers has completed a bridge over the Tigris River.
ref: The Iraq Study Group presented its report at 12.00 GMT today.

src: Ó sèkìlọ̀ wípé kò sií ẹnikẹ́ni tó lè fọwọ́ sọ̀yà wípé ìgbésẹ̀kíìgbésẹ̀ tí ilẹ̀ Iraq bá gbé lásìkò yìí kò lè paná ìjà ẹgbẹ́jẹgbẹ́, làásìgbò tó ń peléke òun èyí tó lẹ̀ mórí lé rògbòdìyàn.
mt: He said that the current situation in Iraq is not conducive to a full-scale war, and that the current situation is not conducive to a full-scale war.
ref: It warns No one can guarantee that any course of action in Iraq at this point will stop sectarian warfare, growing violence, or a slide toward chaos.

src: Àbájádẹ bèrè pèlú ìsìpè fún ìjíròrò gbàngba àti ìgbédìdẹ ìpohùnpọ̀ ní orílè-èdè Améríkà nípa àwọn ípinnu tó ní sẹ pélù Ààrin Gúngún Ìlà-oòrùn.
mt: 2011 United States federal budget cuts are expected to reduce the number of troops in the Pacific Command.
ref: The Report opens with plea for open debate and the formation of a consensus in the United States about the policy towards the Middle East.

src: Ìjábọ̀ náà jẹ́ ǹkan tó le gan ní gbogbo ẹ̀yà ìlànà tuntun ti àwọn adarí sí ìlú Iraq ó sì sọ pé kí wọ́n yí ọ̀nà padà.
mt: The move is part of a new policy to allow all foreign visitors to enter Iraq.
ref: The Report is highly critical of almost every aspect of the present policy of the Executive towards Iraq and it urges an immediate change of direction.

src: Ọ̀kan lára àwọn àlàkalẹ̀ méjìdínlọ́gọ́rin ni wípé wọ́n gbọ́dọ̀ gbé ìgbésẹ̀ ìlànà òsèlú kó tó di òpin odún yìí láti le gba ibodè Iraq tako ìdásí tó le, àti sísàtúngbékalẹ̀ àjọsepọ̀ tó dánmọ́rán pẹ̀láwọn alájọgbé.
mt: 2 of the 4 candidates have said they will accept the results of the election to be held this year to determine the next president of Iraq, and to avoid a prolonged dispute among the parties.
ref: First among its 78 recommendations is that a new diplomatic initiative should be taken before the end of this year to secure Iraq’s borders against hostile interventions and to re-establish diplomatic relations with its neighbors.

src: Senato to wa lori oye ati Aya Aare Arabirin Kristina Fenandesi de Kisna kede ipe ohun fe wo idije aare ni irole anaa ni La Plata, ilu ti o je 50 kilometers (31 miles) si Bwenos Aresi.
mt: The Senate approved a bill to rename the capital city of Buenos Aires after former President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner, who was accused of corruption and is now a senator.
ref: Current senator and Argentine First Lady Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner announced her presidential candidacy yesterday evening in La Plata, a city 50 kilometers (31 miles) away from Buenos Aires.

src: Arábìnrin Kirchner kéde èróngbà láti díje dunpò ààrẹ ilé ìseré ìtàgé Argentine, ibùdó kanáà tí ó lò fún ìpolongo rẹ̀ fún ìdìbò asòfin gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ aṣojú ẹkùn Buenos Aires.
mt: 26-year-old Kirchner announced her candidacy for president of Argentina, a position she is eligible for as a member of the Buenos Aires Province legislature.
ref: Mrs. Kirchner announced her intention to run for president at the Argentine Theatre, the same location she used to start her 2005 campaign for the Senate as member of the Buenos Aires province delegation.

src: Ìjiyàn náà bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti àríyàn jiyàn lóri owó ìtura àtí àtúnkọ́ ilé ní ìgbà Ọrikénì, tí àwọn konsafetifu tí fi yẹ̀yẹ́ sọ lórúkọ “Ìṣòwò Olinsi Titun Buṣì”.
mt: The company, which calls itself "The Real Estate Investment Trust", has been accused of fraudulently selling shares.
ref: The debate was sparked by controversy over spending on relief and reconstruction in the wake Hurricane Katrina; which some fiscal conservatives have humorously labeled "Bush's New Orleans Deal."

src: Ìbániwí tí kò le ti agbára àtúnkọ́lé tí fẹ́ gbé iṣẹ́ àtúnkọ́lé fún àwọn ọmọ ìlú Washington.
mt: A bill that would have allowed Washington residents to vote on a state income tax failed.
ref: Liberal criticism of the reconstruction effort has focused on the awarding of reconstruction contracts to perceived Washington insiders.

src: Ó kọjá èyan milionu mẹ́rin tó lọsí Romu fún ìsìnkú náà.
mt: 4 million people have died from the disease in Rome.
ref: Over four million people went to Rome to attend the funeral.

src: Iye àwọn ènìyàn tí ó péjọ pọ̀ tóbẹ́ẹ̀ gẹ́ tí ó fi jẹ́ pé kò ṣe é ṣe fún gbogbo ènìyàn láti rí àyè wọlé fún ìsìnkú ní ilé ìjọsìn St. Peter.
mt: 1,000 people attended the funeral of a man who was not allowed to see his newborn son in the St. Peter's Hospital.
ref: The number of people present was so large that it was not possible for everybody to gain access to the funeral in St. Peter's Square.

src: Ọnírúurú àwọn ẹ̀rọ amóhùnmáwòrán tójú wọn tóbi ní a sàfilọ́lẹ̀ káàkiri agbègbè ní ilẹ̀ Roomu láti lè jẹ́ kàwọn ènìyàn wo ayẹyẹ.
mt: The police have been deployed to the area to prevent looting.
ref: Several large television screens were installed in various places in Rome to let the people watch the ceremony.

src: Ni ọpọ awọn ilu omiran ni Italy ati ni iyoku agbaye, papa julọ ni Poland, iru agbekalẹ bayi wa, eyi ti opolopo eniyan ri.
mt: In Italy and across Europe, the most common cause of death is heart disease, followed by cancer.
ref: In many other cities of Italy and in the rest of the world, particularly in Poland, similar setups were made, which were viewed by a great number of people.

src: Àwọn akọ̀tàn ti se àríwísí àwọn ètò ìmúlò àtẹ̀yìnwá ọ́fíìsì àjọ àpapọ̀ òtẹlẹ̀múyé fún lílo ìsúná rè lòrì àwọn ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ tó rọrùn láti yanjú, ní pàtàkì àwọn ọ̀ràn jíjí ọkọ̀ áyọkẹ́lẹ́ pẹ̀lú èróngbá láti se ìgbélárugẹ fún ódiwọ̀n àsẹyọrì rẹ.
mt: The hotel chain's public relations team has been working to quell rumors of a possible terrorist attack, after the hotel's security guard was found dead with his throat slit.
ref: Historians have criticized past FBI policies for focusing resources on cases which are easy to solve, especially stolen car cases, with the intent of boosting the agency's success rate.

src: Àpérò bẹ̀rl sí ní kó owó sí obcenity initiative ní fiscal n\i ọdún 2005 ó sì so pé àwọn FBI nílái fi aṣojú mẹ́wàá sílẹ̀ fún fíìmù àgbàlagbà.
mt: 2005 federal budget included a tax on obscenity, and the FBI seized 250,000 pornographic films.
ref: Congress began funding the obscenity initiative in fiscal 2005 and specified that the FBI must devote 10 agents to adult pornography.

src: Robin Uthappa wọlé pẹ̀lú góòlù tó ga jùlọ bí i àádọ́rin pẹ̀lú bọ́ọ̀lù mọ́kànlélógì nípa gbígbá mẹ́rin mọ́kànlá àti mẹ́fà méjì.
mt: Robin Uthappa scored a record 19 runs with a four and five sixes.
ref: Robin Uthappa made the innings highest score, 70 runs in just 41 balls by hitting 11 fours and 2 sixes.

src: Middle order batsmen, Sachin Tendulkar and Rahul Dravid, ṣe dáadáa tí wọ́n sì ní ọgọ́rùn ún àjọsepọ̀.
mt: Middle order batsmen, Sachin Tendulkar and Rahul Dravid, scored 100 runs in partnership.
ref: Middle order batsmen, Sachin Tendulkar and Rahul Dravid, performed well and made a hundred-run partnership.

src: Ṣùgban lẹ́yìn tí wọ́n sọ captain wicket nù India ṣe 36 runs tí wọ́n sì sọ wicket 7 nù láti parí rẹ̀.
mt: 36 runs were scored by India's captain after 7 wickets were taken to end the innings.
ref: But, after losing the captain's wicket India only made 36 runs loosing 7 wickets to end the innings.

src: Olori oorilrede U.S to n je George W. Bush de si ilu Singapore ni aro ojo ikerindinlogun ninu osu kokanla, eyi to fi bere awoyika ilu Asia olose kan.
mt: U.S. President George W. Bush arrived in Singapore on Monday, the first stop on a week-long tour of Asia.
ref: U.S. President George W. Bush arrived in Singapore the morning of November 16, beginning a week-long tour of Asia.

src: Igbákejì Olórí Singapo Wongi Kani Sengi ló kíi o dẹ̀ sọ̀rọ̀ ní ba isòwò àti ọ̀rọ̀ ìhàlẹ̀ pẹ̀lú Olórí Singapo Lee Hsien Loongi.
mt: Singapore's Deputy Prime Minister Wong Kan Seng will meet with Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong to discuss trade and domestic issues.
ref: He was greeted by Singapore's Deputy Prime Minister Wong Kan Seng and discussed trade and terrorism issues with the Singapore Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong.

src: Lẹ́yin àdánu ọ̀sẹ̀ kan nínú ètò ìdìbò ìdajì sáà, Bush sọ fún àkójọpọ̀ àwọn èro rẹ̀ nípa sísàmúngbòrò kátàkárà ní ilẹ̀ Asia.
mt: After a week of campaigning in Asia, Bush spoke to a crowd of thousands in South Korea.
ref: After a week of losses in the midterm election, Bush told an audience about the expansion of trade in Asia.

src: Adari ijọba Stephen Harper ti gba lati fi iwe erongba ijọba lori “Clean Air Act” ranṣẹ si ijoko awon ọmọ ẹgbẹ fun agbeyẹwo, ki oto di kika fun igba elekeji lọyin ipade ọjọ iṣẹgun oni iṣẹju mẹẹdọgbọn pẹlu adari NDP Jack Layton ni PMO.
mt: Prime Minister Stephen Harper was handed a copy of the "Clean Air Act" by Environment Minister John Baird, who was joined by Conservative MPs for a photo-op, as the government announced the bill's second reading on Monday, the first day of the fall session of Parliament, with NDP Leader Jack Layton in tow.
ref: Prime Minister Stephen Harper has agreed to send the government's 'Clean Air Act' to an all-party committee for review, before its second reading, after Tuesday's 25 minute meeting with NDP leader Jack Layton at the PMO.

src: Laytoni ti bèèrè fún àyípadà lórí òfin ìhùwàsí àyíká lákòókò ìpàdé pẹ̀lú PM, bèèrè pé kí wọ́n se àtúnkọ àbádòfin ìhùwà ẹgbẹ́ sí àyíká.
mt: Laytoni ti bèèrè fún àyípadà lórí òfin ìhùwàsí àyíká lákòókò ìpàdé pẹ̀lú PM, bèèrè pé kí wọ́n se àtúnkọ àbádòfin ìhùwà ẹgbẹ́ sí àyíká.
ref: Layton had asked for changes to the conservatives' environmental bill during the meeting with the PM, asking for a "thorough and complete rewriting" of the Conservative party's environmental bill.

src: Láti ìgbà tí ìjọba àpapọ̀ ti gba ìsúná ilé ìwòsàn Mersey tí ó wà ní Devonport, ní Tasmania, ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ àti àwọn Aṣojú ìjọbá àpapọ̀ ti bu ẹnu àtẹ́ lu ìgbésẹ̀ yìí gẹ́gẹ́ bí ètè tí ó ní í ṣe pẹlú ètò ìdìbò tó ń bọ̀ ní oṣù kọkànlá.
mt: The government of the United Kingdom has announced that it will be holding a referendum on whether to leave the European Union.
ref: Ever since the Federal Government stepped in to take over funding of the Mersey hospital in Devonport, Tasmania, the state government and some federal MPs have criticised this act as a stunt in the prelude to the federal election to be called by November.

src: Ṣùgbọ́n Mínísítà àgbà, John Howard ti sọ wípé àbá náà wà fún àbò àwọn ohun èlò ilé ìwòsàn náà, kí ìjọba Tasmanian má ba à fi wọ́lẹ̀, ní gbigbé milíọ́nù márùndínlógójì dọ́là sílẹ̀.
mt: However, Prime Minister John Howard said the government had already committed $1.5 million to the project, with the Tasmanian government to match it.
ref: But Prime Minister John Howard has said the act was only to safeguard the facilities of the hospital from being downgraded by the Tasmanian government, in giving an extra AUD$45 million.

src: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìròyìn tuntun ṣe wí, ìpelé odò takasí pé wọ́n fa tsunami ni. Àwọn iṣe tsunami ti wọ́n ṣàkọsílẹ̀ ní tòsí Pago Pago àti Niue.
mt: Latest reports say the tsunami was triggered by an earthquake. The tsunami hit Pago Pago and Niue.
ref: According to the latest bulletin, sea level readings indicated a tsunami was generated. There was some definite tsunami activity recorded near Pago Pago and Niue.

src: Wọn ò jésì ìpalára tàbí ìjàmba púpọ̀jù ní Tonga, ṣùgbọ́n iná ṣẹ́jú fún ìgbà kan, tó mú kí àwọn aláṣẹ Tonga má rí ìkilọ̀ ìjì súnámì tí PWC gbéjáde.
mt: The Tongan government has not yet released the full report, but it is expected to be made public in the near future.
ref: No major damage or injuries have been reported in Tonga, but power was temporarily lost, which reportedly prevented Tongan authorities from receiving the tsunami warning issued by the PTWC.

src: Àwọn ilé ìwé mẹ́rìnlà ní Hawaii tó wà ní tàbí tó wà ní ẹ̀gbẹ́ etí òkun ti jẹ́ títìpa ní ọjọ́rú pẹ̀lú bí wọ́n ṣe yọ ìkìlọ̀ kúrò.
mt: 15 schools in Hawaii were closed on Monday due to a tsunami warning after a 7.7 magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of Chile.
ref: Fourteen schools in Hawaii located on or near coastlines were closed all of Wednesday despite the warnings being lifted.

src: Ààrẹ orilé-ẹ̀dẹ̀ Améríkà George W. Bush gba ìkẹ́de náà wọlé.
mt: U.S. President George W. Bush was briefed on the incident.
ref: U.S. President George W. Bush welcomed the announcement.

src: Ẹni tó sọ̀rọ̀ fún Búsì Godoni Johanudro pé ilérí Koria Ariwa ní “ìgbésẹ̀ nlá sọ́na àlébá láti yọ irin ogún nukilia kúrò ní irekusu Koria.
mt: Busi Godoni Johanudro said the Korean Airline was “a symbol of the country’s economic development” and that it was “a great loss to the Korean people.”
ref: Bush spokesman Gordon Johndroe called North Korea's pledge "a major step towards the goal of achieving the verifiable denuclearization of the Korean peninsula."

src: Ìjì lílé kẹwàá ti sáà Atlantic Hurricane, Subtropical Storm Jerry, ni wọ́n sẹ̀dà ní ọ̀sà Atlantic lónìí.
mt: 2019 Atlantic hurricane season, Subtropical Storm Jerry, was named on August 30.
ref: The tenth named storm of the Atlantic Hurricane season, Subtropical Storm Jerry, formed in the Atlantic Ocean today.

src: Ibùdó Ìjì líli Orílẹ̀ èdè (NHC) sọ pé ní àsìkò yìí Jerry kò lè ṣe ǹkan kan ní orí ilẹ̀.
mt: The National Hurricane Center (NHC) said at this time Jerry is not expected to make landfall.
ref: The National Hurricane Center (NHC) says that at this point Jerry poses no threat to land.

src: Àwọn ẹgbẹ́ ológun ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà tí ẹ̀ka onímọ̀ ẹ̀rọ, ṣe ìṣirò pé tí òjọ̀ bá rọ ìwọ̀n íǹṣì mẹ́fà péré, yóò dí ojú ihò ewé tó ti bàjẹ́ tẹ́lẹ.
mt: The U.S. Navy's Blue Angels aerobatic team said it will not perform at the upcoming air show in Dayton, Ohio, after a jet crashed and killed the pilot during a practice session last week.
ref: The U.S. Corps of Engineers estimated that 6 inches of rainfall could breach the previously damaged levees.

src: Ìpín Kẹ̀sán, tó ní ìrírí ẹ̀kúnwọ́ tó ga tó ìwọ̀n bàtà ogún nínú ìjì líle Katrina, lọ́wọ́ lọ́wọ́ ti máa ní gíga tó ègbé ikùn bí ìdarí omi tó sún mọ́tí di bíbò mọ́lẹ. .
mt: New Orleans, which suffered $100 billion in damage from Hurricane Katrina in 2005, is now facing a new threat: a giant sinkhole that has swallowed up a street and threatens to swallow up more.
ref: The Ninth Ward, which saw flooding as high as 20 feet during Hurricane Katrina, is currently in waist-high water as the nearby levee was overtopped.

src: Omi ń sàn lórí levee ní apá kan níwọ̀n fífẹ̀ ẹsẹ̀ ọgọ́rùn ún.
mt: 2 people were injured when a car fell into a canal.
ref: Water is spilling over the levee in a section 100 feet wide.

src: Alákòóso tó wọ́pọ̀ Adam Cuerden ti fi ìpinlẹẹ̀mí ọkàn hàn lórí àwọn ìparẹ́ tó wáyé lákòókò tó ń sọ̀rọ̀ ní Wikinews lóṣù tó kọjá.
mt: 2014-12-29 17:00:00 (UTC) Adam Cuerden has been awarded the Editor of the Year award for 2014.
ref: Commons Administrator Adam Cuerden expressed his frustration over the deletions when he spoke to Wikinews last month.

src: “Ó [Wales] parọ́ fún wa láti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀. Àkọ́kọ́ nípa síseré àfi bí èyí wà fú idí òfin. Ìkejì, nípa dídíbọ́n pé òun gbọ́ wa títí di bí ó se pa iṣẹ́ ọnà rẹ́.”
mt: “He [Wales] has been with us from the beginning. First, in terms of the legislation. Second, in terms of his commitment to see us through to the end.”
ref: "He [Wales] basically lied to us from the start. First, by acting as if this was for legal reasons. Second, by pretending he was listening to us, right up to his art deletion."

src: Ìkórira agbègbè náà fa agbára láti kọ ìlànà tó ní ṣe pẹ̀lú ìbálòpọ́ fún ojú òpó tó gba àlejò tó mílíọ́nù mídíà gbangba.
mt: The area has been cordoned off to allow for the removal of the plane's black box, which is expected to cost millions of dollars.
ref: The community irritation led to current efforts to draft a policy regarding sexual content for the site which hosts millions of openly-licensed media.

src: Isé sísẹ náà lọ́pọ̀lọpọ̀ jẹ fún ẹ̀kọ́, sùgbón kíkọ́ ètò náà jẹ láti sẹ àfiwẹ́ra àkíyèsí tó di sísẹ nípa Sagirrarius lójú òrun.
mt: The crash was the first of two fatal accidents involving Gripen aircraft in 2013, the other being a South African Air Force Gripen that crashed on 25 August.
ref: The work done was mostly theoretical, but the program was written to simulate observations made of the Sagittarius galaxy.

src: Awon agbara iji omi lo le ko ipa ti egbe naa n wa laarin ohun dudu galaksi ati nkan dudu Ona Milik.
mt: The forces of gravity can bend the light of a galaxy into a dark ring, as seen in the galaxy M87.
ref: The effect the team was looking for would be caused by tidal forces between the galaxy's dark matter and the Milky Way's dark matter.

src: Gẹ́lẹ́ bí òṣùpá ṣe ń ṣe pẹlú ayé, tí yóò sì jẹ́ kí ó gún, bẹ́ẹ̀ ni Milky Way ṣe máa ń ṣe pẹ̀lú Sagittarius galaxy.
mt: As the galaxy ages, it is losing its gas, which is the fuel for star formation, and the Milky Way is losing its grip on the Sagittarius galaxy.
ref: Just like the moon exerts a pull on the earth, causing tides, so does the Milky Way exert a force on the Sagittarius galaxy.

src: O ṣeéṣe fún àwọn onímọ̀ sáyẹnsì latí pinu pé ohun dúdú ma ń ran ohun dúdú mín bí ohun désé ṣe ma n ràn án.
mt: The scientists say that the device can detect the presence of a substance by detecting the absence of a substance that is normally present.
ref: The scientists were able to conclude that the dark matter affect other dark matter in the same way regular matter does.

src: Àlàyé yìí sọ pé àwọn ǹkan dúdú tó wà ní àyíkà galaxy ló wà ní àyíká galaxy gẹ́gẹ́ bí halo, àwọn ǹkan kékèké ló gbedúró.
mt: This article states that the dark matter in the galaxy is in the halo, and the normal matter is in the disk.
ref: This theory says that most dark matter around a galaxy is located around a galaxy in a kind of halo, and is made of lots of small particles.

src: Iroyin lati ori amohunmaworan fihan pe efin n jade lati inu koriko wa.
mt: A report from the Ministry of Defense said the plane was shot down by a missile.
ref: Television reports show white smoke coming from the plant.

src: Àwọn aláṣẹ abẹ́lé ti ń sèkìlọ̀ fáwọn òsìṣẹ́ lágbègbè iléeṣẹ́ láti dúró sílé, pa ẹ̀rọ amúnlétutù, kí wọ́n má sì mú omi ẹ̀rọ.
mt: Authorities closed the airport to commercial flights, extinguished the fire and drained the fuel.
ref: Local authorities are warning residents in the vicinity of the plant to stay indoors, turn off air-conditioners and not to drink tap water.

src: Ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú àjọ ohun àmúsagbàra ti Japan, kẹ́míkà tóní ìpalára àti iodine tí di àwárí ní ilé́ isẹ́ náà.
mt: The Japan Atomic Energy Agency, which operates the plant, said the levels of cesium, strontium and iodine had risen at the plant.
ref: According to Japan's nuclear agency, radioactive caesium and iodine has been identified at the plant.

src: Awon alase ma n daba pe eyi toka si pe awon kolo to n di epo uraniumu ni ni oju ibe le ti be ati pe o n jo.
mt: Some experts say that the radiation from the nuclear waste could be dangerous to the environment and people.
ref: Authorities speculate that this indicates that containers holding uranium fuel at the site may have ruptured and are leaking.

src: Dr. Tony Moll sàwárí Extremely Drug Resistant Tuberculosis (XDR-TB) ní KwaZulu-Natal lẹ́kùn South African.
mt: Dr. Tony Moll discovered Extremely Drug Resistant Tuberculosis (XDR-TB) in KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa.
ref: Dr. Tony Moll discovered the Extremely Drug Resistant Tuberculosis (XDR-TB) in the South African region KwaZulu-Natal.

src: Ninu iforoworo kan, o wi pe irufe titun naa o n “danilamu pupo o de n fa ijaya nitoripe osuwon iku ti o le sokun fa, o ga.”
mt: In one of the reports, it was said that the pilot was “very experienced and had flown many times before,” because of the lack of experience he had, he died.
ref: In an interview, he said the new variant was "very highly troubling and alarming because of the very high fatality rate."

src: Dokita Moli ro wipe awon alaisan kan leti fara ko kokoro naa ni ile-iwosan,ati wipe meji lara won je osise eleto ile-iwosan naa.
mt: 2 of the 3 injured were taken to the hospital, the other was treated at the scene.
ref: Some patients might have contracted the bug in the hospital, Dr. Moll thinks, and at least two were hospital health workers.
